page.title: 01SURVEY OF THE AREA
page.content: The majority of this block is within the Borough of Solihull. A small part on the southern edge is in Warwickshire. This is a rural area with just two small settlements; the village of Chadwick End which is on the main Birmingham-Warwick road and a small group of houses at Fen End. Part of Temple Balsall is also in the block. The nearest main village is Balsall Common which is just above the north-eastern edge of the block. At Fen End there is an old RAF airstrip which is now used by Lucas as a test track. The houses their now form a small council estate. Most of the land is used for growing crops and as pasture land. The fields are often very small and criss-crossed with drainage ditches. The pasture is not of very good quality.
